description:
Silent Crash is a social deduction bidding game of cornering the market on shifting resources.

â€‹It is a 3-11 player game running to roughly 30 minutes play time per round. It requires nothing apart from the 2 page low ink PDF file available for download and printing at the bottom of the page. 

It is a simple bidding, bluffing and social deduction game designed to represent competing to corner the market on various stock market shares. Knowing if you've successfully controlled the market and betting accordingly is the root to financial success and crushing your competition. 

Originally designed based on a hidden loyalty bidding mechanic for a multi-player wargame, Silent Crash became too complicated to be part of another game, but not fully developed enough for a full release. As such we have made it available as a free Print and Play.

Players bid on whether they have the resource which occurs the lowest unique number of times. They gain points by successfully doing so and can swap resources based on other player's bids.  

—description from the publisher

A simple, competitive dice party game best for larger groups.

Each turn you roll your dice and depending on the results choose to either add to the lobster which helps you achieve the winning goal of getting rid of all your dice or create a claw to cut the lobster which lets you hand out the severed dice to your opponents pushing them further away from winning.

—description from the designer

In Pearls, players dive for valuable pearls, then try to sell them at local markets. You either collect or score pearl cards of the same color (and value) on your turn. Cards with higher value score more points, but are less common. Pearls with lower value may seem weaker at first, but if you score a larger quantity of cards at once, you receive a necklace card with bonus points, if available. With a hand limit of ten cards, however, this requires clever hand management and timing.

At the end of the game, all pearl and necklace cards in your scoring piles score positive points and any cards left in your hand score minus points. The player with the highest total score wins.

Limite limite Gold is a new expansion for the game Limite Limite, a French implementation of Cards Against Humanity.

The lead player in turn chooses a question with a blank space, other players must choose an answer that must be funny, with the proposed cards having a big chance of being offensive.  A strong knowledge of French language and culture is recommended to understand everything.
Compete against your fellow filthy minded friends in a race to guess the lewd phrase using the iconic language of Badmoji. The player with the most points at the end of two full rounds is the winner.

You secretly pick a running play. Your opponent sets a pass defense. Now go to the special Snap-Action dice for the outcome. Runs, passes, punts, field goals...this pocket-sized game has all the elements of real football...except the crunch of the pads.

—description from the back of the box

Story

Lancelot, the greatest of all of King Arthur’s knights, was accused of having romantic trysts with Queen Guinevere. First to accuse him was Meliagaunt, whom Lancelot challenged in combat to prove the Queen’s innocence. During the contest, Lancelot cleaved his opponent’s head in half and cleared the Queen of those charges. However, rumors continued to abound and soon other knights became suspicious. Sir Agravain and Sir Mordred gathered twelve knights and stormed Guinevere’s chamber, finding Lancelot there with the Queen. Now you, as Sir Lancelot, must try to escape and fight your way out of the castle and prove the innocence of Queen Guinevere before King Arthur has her burned to death for infidelity.

Object of the Game

You are fighting to escape the perils of the castle and, at the same time, trying to defend the Honor of the Queen you love. You will test your Knightly Virtues against those of the 14 knights standing in your way and fight to emerge victorious. If you can defeat 8 of the 14 knights along your path you will clear the name of your Queen and escape into the night. However, all is not as easy as it may seem. With every failure to defeat a knight, your Knightly Virtues will decrease and the Honor of your Queen will move one step closer to peril. Should you lose to 7 knights, or have two of your Virtues reach a value of 0, Lancelot will be banished from the lands and the Queen will burn for her sins.

—description from the publisher

Read all about it! In this era of fake news, can you tell the truth from the lie? Play The News Game and test your powers of deduction, along with your friends, and play this super-fun, laugh-out-loud game.

One person reads out the headline followed by the story and you have to guess whether its real or fake news!

This game contains 100 'true or false' question cards and also comes with full gameplay instructions. A great game for your next dinner party, The News Game is a fabulous gift for lovers of quizzes and current affairs.

—description from the publisher

Somewhere in a dark but distant future, humankind is fighting a war for survival against its greatest threat - a changing climate. The polar ice caps have melted, entire civilizations, swept away almost overnight. A distant rust-covered memory, the world we knew has been swallowed whole, lost in the murky depths of an unforgiving ocean.

Desperate, starving, and lacking the technical achievements of a forgotten era, the surviving population propels steam-powered engines towards the farthest corners of earth in search of the faintest glimmer of hope. Some found this hope on a plot of ocean simply known as the Arena. Through uncharted waters, there lies a thousand islands eroded by time, where untold riches await to be discovered by the remnants of past civilizations. You are among the desperate few in search of those lost treasures.

SteamPunk Arena is a turn-based strategy game with an objective to explore the islands looking for salvage, exploit the resources you find there, expand your domain using bridge networks,  and exterminate your opponent. In SteamPunk Arena, each combatant chooses a faction, and then chooses the hero who will lead that faction into battle. These heroes will help spur theatre-specific units on by providing an action modifying bonus.

The combatants begin the conflict with the same garrisoned unit strength and an equal amount of land; however, this is where your similarities will end. Where you place your Base Tile or Land Tiles is entirely up to you. What lies hidden and waiting to be discovered could also provide a unique advantage or disadvantage.  But keep in mind no matter what your path looks like, the dice-roll will often decide the outcome of events that transpire throughout the playthrough.

Using a turn-based unit action system. The combatant controls the action of active units throughout the duration of the turn until all action points are spent. The health of the unit is determined by a population or hit-point, found in the center of the piece. Units can only be deployed one per turn. There are only so many population points you can have active on the arena game boards at any given time, unless modified by a certain Resource or Unit Bonus. So choose your army wisely and enjoy the fight. We will see you out in the Arena!

Tike’s Dungeon can be played as a solo adventure or as a 2-4 player co-op. Above that, it can be played in two different styles: Turn-based board game where players take turns to explore the crypt and battling creatures and the narrative-driven role-playing game (RPG). In both styles of play, the players will take on the role of a Tike and are highly encouraged to interact with and help each other.

"Raivynwood is a small but prosperous village nestled neatly in the, get this, Raivynwood forest. It is most well known for its local militia which is comprised of some of the most well-trained soldiers in the land. But it has another, rather unfortunate, claim to fame which is a little less known, and that is that Raivynwood is a hub of catastrophe. If anything can go wrong, anything in the world, it will go wrong in Raivynwood. That may be the reason for needing such well-trained men and women, or that could just be a coincidence.
The training in Raivynwood starts at the ripe age of 5, these boys and girls are called the CIC (Combat Initiative Cubs). They mostly play with sticks and wooden shields in childish games that have a fortunate side-effect of teaching them how to kick butt. The Cubs graduate at the age of 7 when they become CIBs (Combat Initiative Bloomer). CIBs practice with dull metal weapons, begin to learn the bow and learn the value of respecting and helping their parents. It’s an important lesson, you know? Finally, at the harsh age of 11, Bloomers get promoted to the Raivynwood CIA (Combat Initiative Adepts). As a junior member of the Raivynwood CIA it is your duty to train hard and watch over your small piece of paradise when the grownups aren’t around.
On this day, of all days… the day on which the grownups have all gone to the eastern forest edge to confront a new lizardfolk threat… misfortune has stricken. As you and your fellow CIA members train in the city square, showing off your moves and flirting with your crush, you are disrupted…"

—description from the designer

In MÅ«, you build a city composed of nine building cards, with these cards coming in five types adorned with "source symbols" for strength, faith, and food. Each edge of a building card has a semi-circle on it showing half of a source symbol. Cards also have complete symbols for strength, faith, and food on them.

Each player starts the game with two project cards — cards fueled by source tokens — and an empty 3×3 grid that shows semi-circular source symbols around the edges. The game lasts four rounds, and in each round you draft three cards. At the end of the second, third, and fourth rounds, all players compare their strengths in various horizontal or vertical rows on their grid.

In the first round, you draft three project cards, each with special effects that can be used if you fill all the source symbols on it. In each of the next three rounds, you draft and play three building cards. When you play a building card and complete one or more source symbols (by matching the colors on each half symbol), you receive a source token of that color for each completed symbol, which you must immediately place on a project.

After the third, sixth, and ninth building cards have been placed, you compare your strength in the row or column indicated on battle cards. (You have two such challenges after rounds six and nine.) The player with the most strength in the appropriate row or column receives 3 achievement points (AP), while the loser marks that row or column with a damage token. If a building card has damage in both its row and column, it's destroyed and removed from the game.

At the end of the game, players feed their city, scoring based on the number of food symbols they have and the number of non-destroyed buildings. Players also score AP for faith symbols in their city.

MÅ« also contains rules for a solitaire game.

Wooden Boardgame for 2-6 players with 60 pigs. 
18x18x4cm

The goal is to get rid of all your pigs.

Distribute all pigs among other players.

On your turn, roll the die (D6) and place one of your pigs into the matching numbered area of the board. If you roll a 6, drop your pig in the pig hole so it goes underneath the board.

If the numbered area you rolled is already full, you take all pigs from that area.

First round, you have to throw the die once. 
Second round, you have to throw the die twice. 
Last round, you can throw the die as many times as you want, but must roll at least once.

—user summary

In the summer of 1941, German panzer spearheads pushed towards Leningrad, Cradle of the Revolution. Adolf Hitler declared the city's capture to be the leading objective of Operation Barbarossa, the June 1941 sneak attack on the Soviet Union. Desperate to stop them and preserve the city of Peter the Great, the Red Army repeatedly made valiant efforts to stop them, and just as often, the Germans rolled over and around them. By August the city had been isolated from the rest of the Soviet Union, but its defenders refused to yield. For 900 days they held against savage Nazi bombardments, writing an epic chapter in the story of the Great Patriotic War.

Gates of Leningrad is a complete Panzer Grenadier game based on based on the German drive to capture Leningrad, and the Soviet defense of the approaches. There are 30 scenarios based on these battles, organized into ten “battle games” that allow you to play the scenarios in sequence toward your army’s operational goals.

—description from the publisher

You are an investigation team sent to a tragic event. A passenger car has crashed  after a short car chase. The driver has fled, while the officer who participated in the hunt lies on the asphalt dead of gun shot wounds. From the trunk of the passenger car, a desperate rattle is heard from a dying woman. Nude, shot and with a strange sign cut into her upper body. Two fingers amputated. You soon find out that she is one of the five women who have disappeared in recent months.

The "ritual" is a macabre crime quest that you must solve. By calculating codes and combinations of tracks on different cards, you dig your way through the investigation.

You start the game via a smartphone at 50clues.com, which keeps track of time and helps you along the way. This is where you enter codes and combine clues from the cards. Making errors or using the help function costs extra time that is added to the total time spent. It's life or death to solve the puzzle quickly.

If you love crime stories and cryptic puzzles, then the "ritual" is for you.

It only takes three minutes to get started with the game.

Nominated for Best Board Game at Fastaval 2018.

Marine microbes form the basis of life in the ocean and perform 50% of earth’s photosynthesis. But they live extraordinary lives of their own; fraught with danger and opportunity.

Oligotrophic is a fast-to-learn, strategic tile placement game where players compete to place biomass the fastest. In the game players will select and play hexagonal cards based on actual microorganisms to accumulate biomass, often getting bonuses, hurting, or taking biomass from the other organisms they encounter.

Oligotrophic is fully available online in both full color and print friendly versions in the files section. All that is needed is 20 cubes of a color for each player.

—description from the designer

To feed your prehistoric clan, your tribespeople must force Mammoths over the side of a cliff. Just be careful that you don't sink into a tarpit, get stomped by a Mammoth — or run right off the cliff yourself in the process. This "Guts-style" game has you trying to outthink your opponents and maneuver them into harm's way...until "WHAMM!", one tribe emerges victorious.

Wooly Whammoth features identical eight-card hands, each card showing a number of spaces that must be moved — but it is the total number, adding all the cards played that hand, which determines just how far ALL the cave people will run. Some have modifiers to slow down or speed up your cave person alone - and quickly getting out of sync with the others is how you will survive and send them over the edge. Getting two spaces from the edge is how you will earn Mammoth Meat as the wooly beasts plunge to the valley below — and it take six Meat tokens to win. BUT to refill your hand, you must eat a Meat, in a lovely balancing act.

Your two-piece modular board becomes elongated after every successful hunt, changing the conditions and lengths individual players have to go to score a Mammoth.

Of course, the other way to win is to eliminate all four of your opponents' tribespeople by forcing them into tar pits, crushing them under CHARGING mammoths, or sending them flying over the cliff. It's a think, double-think, guts game of prehistoric survival!

—description from the publisher

Galactic Bounty Hunt (GBH) is a gateway board game where each player controls one of six different Bounty Hunters that are taking part in the Great Hunt – the ultimate bounty hunting competition, which will determine who’ll earn the position of Leader of the Galactic Bounty Hunter’s Guild. Competitors will have to travel across the Galaxy, capturing dangerous creatures (and earning credits in the process) in different systems before being able to return to the Guild’s HQ and claiming the title of Leader. Equip your character with the best gear available and be on the lookout, for monsters might not be your deadliest foes – other Bounty Hunters might not want to let you earn the so-coveted prize of the Great Hunt! Good hunting!

Features:


     GBH introduces players to many different gameplay mechanics and systems, in an easy to learn way – the perfect introduction to the world of modern board games. Mechanics include dice rolls, card drawing, luck mitigation systems (ammo, equipments,etc), PvP (player-vs-player) combat and more.
     No player elimination and no Kingmaker effect: even when the game seems lost, players can still turn the tide in their favor.
     Beautiful cel-shaded, comic-style art.
     Six different Bounty Hunters to play as, each from a different species and System.
     Twelve different kinds of monsters to capture, two of each element.
     Dozens of different pieces of equipment, from weapon mods to consumable items, will give you an edge, as long as you choose carefully – and can afford them.
     Warp through the Galaxy at light speed using the portals on each System – but take heed, for you can’t be sure where each portal might take you.
     Fortune cards will keep the game unpredictable: they can help or hinder any of the players, independently of who triggered the event. Mix things up a little to turn the tide – for or against you.
     Keep the best monsters you capture as pets to engage in fights with other players.
     Falling behind on your trophy collecting? Not to worry! Board another Hunter’s ship, engage in combat and try to steal one of their trophies.


—description from the publisher

In FAT STACKS, you and your friends compete to build the tallest and tastiest pancake stack! Use classic pancake flavors and toppings, as well as some ~special~ ingredients other chefs wouldn’t dare to use!

The game begins by drawing 4 cards and a buttermilk pancake.  Begin your turn by choosing one of three options: draw 2 cards and play 2 cards from your hand, only draw 3 cards, or only play 3 cards.  Players create stacks of pancakes by playing Pancake and Topping cards from their hand.  Players can place positive cards on their own stacks, and play negative cards to sabotage other players' stacks.

In order for your beautiful (or disgusting) stack to earn a final score, you must top off the stack with a Finisher card.  These special cards are placed in the center of the table and are earned by completing the objective on each card. 
 When a finisher is played, it's special effect triggers immediately and your stack's points are locked in which prevents the stack from being sabotaged by other players.  Any stacks that don't have finishers on them at the end of the game don't earn any points.  This includes stacks that have a negative total value!  The game ends when the deck runs out of cards.

At the end of the game, special Trophy cards are awarded to players for bonus points.  These cards are given to the player with the tallest, finished, pancake stack, the player with the fewest negative items on their stack, and the player who dealt the most damage in one turn.  The points are added up, and the player who earned the most points the end of the game, wins!

FAT STACKS works best with 3-6 players, takes about 40 minutes for a full game, and is recommended for ages 14+.

-description from publisher

In Dizzle, players want to fill their scorecards with dice collected each round. Players take turns selecting dice from the center of the table, and the next die they collect must match the others. At the end of a round, mark all boxes on your scorecard filled with dice.

This might sound simple, but of course others will compete for the dice you need...

En Garde Reforged is a cinematic action card game for 2-6 impeccably dressed Renaissance-era duelists engaged in a pitched clifftop melee. Players must attempt to out maneuver their opponents in a series of one on one duels to prove their technique reigns supreme. Carefully manage your cards and keep calm, cool and collected if you hope to win the day. If you’re attacked at the wrong moment, prepare to taste cold steel!

Each turn the active player will draw a hand of cards, arming themselves with new items and/or restoring their Poise in preparation for the upcoming duel. That player will then begin an Exchange with a player of their choosing by using an Attack card. The way their opponent chooses to defend themselves (or not) may result in a flurry of attacks and counter attacks between the two players, exhausting their Poise in a flurry of flashing thrusts, slashes and lunges. If either player gets hit with an attack while they are at No Poise, they are eliminated from the game!

Be the last player standing after a series of ferocious duels and you win!

Overload is a racing game in which players try to score as many points as possible over several laps. At the start of the game, each player decides how many discs to place on their figure. The more discs you have, the more you score! Whenever someone passes you during the race, you add another disc to your figure — but if you collect too many discs, then you go out of control and need to start the lap again...

So typisch! is a co-operative and communicative game full of stereotypes and clichés! All players fight together for the victory and play against the game. Each round, a single player decides which item to assign to a person, then everyone else must assess how this player has decided. In the end, players win only if they've made more matches than mistakes.

Squeezamals Freeze 'N' Squeeze Game is a twist on the classic game of hot potato. Players take turns making a yummy treat for their Squeezamal to enjoy, and the player caught holding the plush when it's time to eat must pay for the treat! Each game features an exclusive Squeezamal! Colors and styles may vary.

—description from the publisher

A co-operative game for 1 to 4 players. Each player is a key officer on a U-Boat with an associated special action.

Each turn cards are drawn (one at a time) and placed in numbered spaces along an operations track at the top of a board. The crew commander then rolls two die and refers to the card in the space than number represents. If the card does not relate to the current action state of the U-boat. Nothing happens and play proceeds to the next turn and action state.

If the card mentions the current action state, it's instructions are followed.

The goal is to survive four missions of differing difficulty without loosing a crew member or the U-boat.

-description from designer

Wargame rules designed to fight battles during the Sudanese colonial campaigns to relieve Gordon at Khartoum and then to re-conquer the Sudan. 
These rules are intended to be used with 15mm-scale figures mounted on two-figure stands. They are very basic, and follow a simple sequence of actions (orders, movement, fire, melee, retreat).

Find all the fish which are hidden below the water lilies.
Take all the 9 water lily tokens. Turn water lily tokens face down (fish can't be visible): shuffle them and place them randomly on the rotating area of the board. Each player choose a colour, take the corresponding fish token and place it on the scorekeeper on the 0 slot. At his turn, each player rolls the dices: he should choose between the 2 colours of the dices and rotate the swamp till the firefly stops in front of the insect of that colour. Then, the player turns 2 water lily tokens in order to find the correct fish indicated by the dices.
Did you find the correct fish? Place tokens back face down and move your marker for 3 slots on the scorekeeper.
Did you find only one correct fish? Place tokens back face down and move your marker for 1 slot on the scorekeeper.
Did you find both wrong fish? Place tokens back face down in the swamp and your turn ends.
Did you find a black fish, but the dices didn't show that colour? You can't move on your scorekeeper.
Attention: If you get the green colour after rolling the dice, ask another player which fish you should search for.
Game ends when a player reaches 9 points slot on his scorekeeper.

—user summary

A fast-paced fun game in which players compete to be the first to make the sound of an animal or call the name of a fruit.
The player who wins the most cards wins!

     Place all cards in a pile face down.
     One of the players rolls the dice and a card from the pile is flipped over.
     There are 3 possible ways to win a card. The player with the most cards by the end of the game – wins!


—description from the publisher

This game is a fully cooperative game,
people are running along a spiral path and are trying to open 8 wooden doors in order to get out of a dungeon.
Its contents consists of 250 distinct challenges.
Each step to open a door requires to cooperate and develops team competence and spirit in the following fields.


     better knowledge of himself and the others
     self-esteem and group confidence
     creative expression, developing creativity and imagination 
     feelings: expressing feelings and emotions (not judgements)
     listening: observing and listening others in order to better understand his way of life
     cooperation: experimenting with cooperation in order to better understand its advantages compared to competition and concurrence


The game requires some extra material not included in the box
pencil and paper sheets
according to the challenges : players may need, objects from the room, scissors, scotch tape, clothes, blindfold, scarf, rope, watch with seconds, bag,...

—description from the publisher

Phase 10 Strategy is played over several rounds. Each round players take it in turn to move their counter around the board to decide on card combinations called "phases". Players need to plan their moves well, as they can only form a phase if their counter is in the appropriate space. In addition, a player may only make one phase per round. As in traditional Phase 10, players use cards to complete their chose phase. Once a player has completed a phase and got rid of his remaining cards, the round ends. Then all players get new cards and the next round begins. Whoever completes his tenth phase first and then gets rid of his remaining cards, wins! Each deck contains Joker cards which increase the suspense and help players escape a tricky situation.

—description from the publisher (Translated)

Phase 10 Strategy wird über mehrere Runden gespielt, in denen die Spieler reihum ihre Spielsteine so über das Spielbrett bewegen, dass sie Kartenkombinationen bilden können, die als „Phasen“ bezeichnet werden. Die Spieler müssen ihre Züge gut planen, da sie eine Phase nur dann bilden können, wenn ihr Spielstein sich auf dem entsprechenden Feld befindet. Außerdem darf ein Spieler pro Runde nur eine einzige Phase bilden. Sobald ein Spieler eine vollständige Phase ausgespielt hat und seine restlichen Karten losgeworden ist, endet die Runde. Dann erhalten alle Spieler neue Karten und die nächste Runde beginnt. Wer als Erster seine zehnte Phase abschließt und dann seine restlichen Karten loswird, gewinnt! Jedes Kartendeck enthält Joker-Karten, die die Spannung steigern und den Spielern helfen können, einer kniffligen Situation zu entkommen.

—description from the publisher (German)

In Chartae, players take the role of cartographers who try to remember and build an ancient map.

The game is made of only nine square tiles, which represent parts of a map. Each tile has a land zone and a water zone. One player tries to connect land zones, the other water zones. Every turn they have to decide whether they want to rotate a tile or place a new one. When the map is complete, the player who connected the most zones wins.

Chartae is an almost perfect information, minimal but elegant tile placement game, with easy gameplay but also deep strategy.

In this combined deck and bag builder from Brotherwise Games, Evil, Incorporated lets players take the role of super-villains competing to see who can become the most infamous. Players build a deck of plans and resources, recruit special minions, and build an evil lair staffed by those minions. Infamy is acquired over the course of the game, and the player with the most infamy wins!

—description from the publisher

GRES:DESFILE (Carnival Parade), is a card game inspired by Brazilian carnival parades.

Your aim in the game is to combine the cards so that you accumulate the most points, creating the best samba school parade.

The game is divided into two phases. First, you collect the cards and combine them the best you can. This phase ends when the first player calls for the calculation of the results. In the second phase ("Apuração"), players will reveal the cards (show their parades) and the points will be counted. The player with the most points wins.

Be careful! You lose valuable points if it rains during your parade or your "Barracão" (art studio) burns down. But you can also be lucky and get some money from unconventional sources or have a little help from biased judges. So, prepare your strategy and make a carnival parade to remember!!!

—description from the publisher

Chaos Kingdoms is a high fantasy board game with an immersive world map. Players take on the role of adventuring Heroes, each with their own set of unique skills and strange character. A Faction of cohorts carry the Hero’s flag, lending their own abilities to their leader. There are 3 legendary goals before them: Last Man Standing, Immortality or Godhood. As they advance, players vanquish rival Heroes, explore dungeons, and spike their power with experience & plunder.

How to WIN:

For lively game play, there are 3 ways to win. 
Last Man Standing: PVP, Player Elimination
Immortality: Battle 4 Jabberwockies to get 4 artifact pieces that grant Immortality
Godhood: Build 5 glorious shrines to yourself in 5 cities

Gameplay:

Game play is relatively simple, making it an easy-entry game for novices. There are 12 Heroes and 12 Factions to choose from, which provides a multitude of strategic combinations. Roll a six-sided dice to travel a classic RPG hex map. Boldly engage with monsters and villains in dungeons and lairs. Battles are a contest of attack rolls with modifiers from pulsing Magic Items and burning Spells. Once powerful enough, conquer fellow Heroes, claim Immortality, or climb into the vaulted existence of a God.

Game Features include:
A multitude of different Hero / Faction combinations
Exploring Dungeons, Ruins, Caves, Hideouts, Towers & more
Unique Artifacts, Weapons & Spells
Fierce PVP and long range attacks
Stealing (very fun and effective)
Targeting opponent Cities
Targeting opponent Items and Followers
Goal: PVP Last Man Standing
Goal: Immortality / Jabberwockies
Goal: Godhood / Shrines
Ruling the World of Chaos Kingdoms

—description from the publisher

Abar Depth will take you to a deadly dangerous reef, that most don't come back alive from. Filled with sunken ships and endless caverns it tempts lots of adventurers and artifact seekers. Many end up in a nearby tavern instead though, and play a game of magical dice. Dice, that can tell stories about adventures that were, and these that could have been. And there’s a lot of gold and treasures at stake.

Abar Depth is centered around said game of dice. 2 to 5 players can sit by a table together.

Each person rolls 2 dungeon dice, picks 3 character dice and attempts to defeat others in a game filled with treason, monsters and artifact hunting. Dice belong to different hero classes and offer actions like healing, attacking players or summoning a giant demon.

One throw with both dice and already a combination of 2 colours is lying on the table. Who can find the right child from 21 cards with trousers and jacket in the same colour combination as the thrown dice?
—description from the publisher (translated)

Das kunterbunte Farben-Suchspiel für 2 und mehr Spieler ab 3 Jahren.

Ein Wurf mit den beiden Würfeln - und schon liegt eine Farben-Kombination auf dem Tisch. Wer findet zuerst das richtige Kind unter den 21 Kärtchen, dessen Hose und Jacke der gewürfelten Farbkombination entspricht?
—description from the publisher

In Superzeroes vs Evil, each player will operate a superzeroes team that will try to overcome evil in all its forms. In this 2-4 player game that last 5 minutes, you'll need to cooperate to achieve your goal.

Players each have a hand composed of 7 cards. At the same time, they will all play a card to create a pool of damage and elements that they will use to kill the threat. If they are not able to defeat the threat, they can play another card or recall their hand and play a new card. Once the threat is defeated, a new one will appear. That goes on until the final boss is revealed!

If you can defeat the boss in under 5 minutes, you'll be the victor! If not, Evil shall prevails and dominate the world.

—description from the publisher

Sigma the monkey really likes the alphabet and he is trying to learn the letters. Help him find the first letter in words, or the picture of an object that starts with a certain letter.

Bingo meets memory in this game where you help Sigma the monkey to find the letter matching your picture, or the other way around.

First player to fill all their double cards wins

This pretty game is fun to play and introduces skip counting, the concept behind multiplication. Players learn to count by twos and by fives as they tally the points they collect to win.

The entire deck is dealt out evenly to each player. Players then take turns drawing a random card from the player to their left when it is their turn trying to get and play matching pairs. Once all matching cards have been played, the player holding the remaining fairy queen card (which doesn't have a match) adds that card to their matches. All players then add up the points shown on their cards, and the player with the most points is the winner.

Contents: 48 playing cards (3.25 x 4.5 inches) and instructions

Drinking games are fucked! Unless you're some kind of alcoholic super-Chad who shits frat parties or a walking rule book, the games are an impediment to your liquor. And worse yet, if you do manage to eek out a victory, it's the LOSERS who get to drink! Fuck that shit. WINNERS DRINK.

This game was made from a lifetime of sitting around bullshitting in bars and getting kicked out of those bars and getting into heated arguments with people over stupid shit and screwing up with women. If you play this game, those things will probably happen to you.

Players draw a card from the 52 card deck which are comprised of 5 categories: Balls, Contest, Truth Bombs, Rage, and Wild Cards. Balls present you with a social challenge to overcome. A contest will pit you in a challenge against other players. Truth Bomb will reveal more about your friends than you ever thought you'd care to know and you'll learn what minute details of life are causing your friends to feel a rage this week.

Each card type has its own challenge to win at. Players that win a card, keep the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game, wins.

—description from the publisher

Evil had beset the village, and we were their last hope. We could not ignore our duty, so we set out on one last quest. We fell one by one, until I was the last survivor. Holding steadfast, I swung my axe one last time. As I crashed to the ground, I knew I had found, at last, peace.

Ragemore is an 18 card solo game where you will complete quests, while managing your hand and resources as you delve though the dark, fighting demons, all in a span of 10-15 minutes.

Each card is two sided; a demon and a hero. In the beginning of the game, the player will set up 2 piles of demon-sided quests and a party of 3 hero-sided cards. Then an immediate threat is revealed from the draw deck as the current demon card that may or may not be dealt with. If it is not killed, the demon card will go to one of the quests piles and an event written on that card will take effect. If it is killed, the demon card is flipped to the hero side and becomes one of the party. The player can also ignore the immediate demon threat and goes on a quest to obtain the win condition, or parlay with some of the demons to turn them into heroes but with the cost of the hero's morality: the hero is flipped to the demon side and joins the draw deck of demons.

The game is won when the hero gains the required number of quest card by using a combination of four symbols drawn on each cards. The game is lost when the graveyard has 3 deaths or when a quest pile has 4 demons or the party has no more heroes or the draw deck of demons is empty before the number of quest cards is fulfilled or if the quest piles are empty before the number of quest cards is fulfilled. 1 winning condition and 5 losing conditions.


Released in the May 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $20+ package.

"Special Edition UNO" with a Coca-Cola theme.

WHAT MAKES THEM DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO:
This version adds a unique "Thirst card" with the following ability: "When this card is played, the player who plays it may select any player to have their thirst quenched. The player selected must draw cards from the deck until he or she draws either a red suited card or any wold card. Upon drawing a red suited card or any wild card the player is to place it in the discard pile. Prior to resuming play the player who plays the card also determines the color to be played in the next round by announcing his/her choice of red, yellow, green or blue."

In Botanists, players tend a small area of land to grow flowers, which they then hope to sell. As botanists, each of the players has three small plots of land dedicated to growing the most popular flowers among their usual clients. However, all players obtain the seeds to those flowers from the same supplier, and because not all flowers are equally popular, the supplier only sells the seeds in bundles, on top of that, other botanists might attempt to snatch certain seeds away from under your nose!

Players take turns in acquiring flowers from the flower market. To do so, they may first move and then play a card that determines what "bundle" they are buying.

With each purchase, players will acquire seeds they are not looking for, so players are required to keep an eye out for open orders to make sure they make the best out of each turn.

Alternatively, players may choose to tend their marginal land (not so fertile), in which case they won't be able to buy new seeds, but instead will be able to trigger a bonus action. In doing so however, players will end up with withered flowers, which will generate negative points at the end of the game.

At the end of their turn, players check the open orders and if they are able to fulfill any of them, they not only earn bonus points, but also get rid of potential negative points.

—description from publisher

Play as a squirrel or a chipmunk collecting nuts by matching corresponding die rolls to a card. Then stash cards won by matching numbers or adding up nut cards to equal stash cards. The most nuts stashed along with bonus points at the end wins.

An Undeniable Victory is a simulation of Iran’s first large-scale offensive in its war against Iraq. The previous year Iraqi forces had captured large swaths of Iranian territory. With the front line dangerously close to Khorramshahr, the Mullahs in Tehran ordered the Iranian military to launch an offensive at the earliest opportunity to eliminate the threat to this vital Iranian city and production center.

An earlier, smaller Iranian offensive, Operation Hoveyzeh, was easily repulsed by the Iraqis in January. As evidence grew of another Iranian attack, the Iraqis entrenched and awaited their enemy’s actions. Any further offensives by the Iraqis were out of the question until the severe losses in men and material from the previous year could be replaced.

The Iranian offensive in March would be supported by three divisions of the newly created Pasdaran, or revolutionary guards. Composed of youthful recruits, many of them not even out of high school, the Pasdaran was created by the mullahs as a “revolutionary counterweight” to the Iranian military, which the religious leaders suspected of harboring many who were still loyal to the ousted Shah. Much would be at stake at this battle, both at the front and behind the lines.

An Undeniable Victory is a two player game intended to be an easy-to-learn game suitable for new gamers, as well as a challenging and fun contest for veteran Grognards. The game can also be easily played solitaire, however.

—description from the publisher

Monumentum is an adventure and exploration game.  Players each have a set of 12 tiles, each tile has two actions. When player choose them, they can either do one or both of the actions. Three tiles are chosen by each player secretly, then players reveal their actions and take turns executing them.  They move over a map board, discovering resources, magic tokens, strange monsters, and reclusive monks that teach new skills. Players can use magic tokens to learn spells, enhance their attributes temporarily and control monsters to hamper other players.  Each player attempts to complete 3 honor tasks, to build 4 monuments, build one gold monument, and slay the dragon. The first player to complete these tasks wins. If no player completes all three, the winner is the one with the most points.   Points are gained by completing numerous smaller missions during the game.

—description from the publisher

Players take the role of farmers in Wisconsin after the industrial revolution that are expanding into new areas of the business world.

REAL ESTATE
Players travel around Wisconsin and purchase and sell real estate for their companies. Each type of property has a different purpose. They are: railroads, shops, inns, banks, forests, mines, farms, factories, and harbours.

PRICE MANAGEMENT
Presidents of companies can adjust the prices at their properties that may be utilized by other players. They may sell low to attract business or undersell competition, or sell high if they have a monopoly in a particular business.

TRAVELLING
Players try to avoid shops and inns that are too expensive while on their business trips, and visit other cities using the railroad, again trying to avoid overpriced trips.

ANTITRUST LEGISLATION
Players can also visit the capital building in Madison in an attempt to set legal limits on prices in certain industries.

SHARE TRADING AND TAKEOVERS
Presidents of companies can buy and sell shares of stock of other players' companies. This can be done for profit or to attempt a company takeover.

—description from the designer

You are a Preacher and you made a deal with the Devil to live 100 years more, and to fulfill your end of the deal, you must collect a 100-year worth of souls. Souls of sinners. To do that, you lure the sinners into your church to “repent”.

You start with a Murderer in your church, then summon 1 of the 9 Demons to choose from, and start luring the sinners to your church. There are 9 kind of Sinners to lure to your church, 7 Sacraments to perform and 1 Good Samaritan to help out, and each has a special power! Make sure your murderer stays in your church so that you can collect the souls of sinners!

The game is played over a series of rounds. In each round, players draw fresh hands of cards, take turns playing cards until the round is finished, and then do the scoring. First to collect 100 (or higher) souls, wins.

Sinners was in 2019 Two-Player PnP Game Design Contest and it was the 2nd Best Gateway Game :)

—description from the publisher

Travel version of Party & Co.
You don't need a playing board!

Party & Co card game is a game for 4 or more players.
A team consist of a minimum of 2 players.

One of the teams rolls the dice and takes a card. On every card there are 4 challenges, every category 1 challenge.
There are 4 categories: Art&Co, Show&Co, Quiz&Co and Crazy&Co.

You have 30 seconds for completing a challenge.
Before you start the challenge you can place a bet per team.
For example the challenge is: How many cartoon figures can you draw? Then each team can place a bet (bonus card) on that challenge. The team that wins collects the bonus cards.

The goal of the game is to collect 10 bonus cards.

—user summary

The plans to Rick’s portal gun have been stolen! It’s up to Rick, Morty, Summer, Jerry, Beth and Mr. Poopybutthole to get them back. They must find out WHO stole the plans, WHERE they are hiding, and WHAT item they used to succeed in the heist. It’s an inter-dimensional mystery!

It plays exactly like Clue with a few additional rules and slight changes. First off, you use two dice to get around the board because of the way the board is shaped. Second, none of the character models are possible murderers in the game, instead they have been replaced by six random characters from the series on cardboard tokens. Third, there’s an added Contraption Card pile that you can get by landing on a “?” spot. Lastly, all of the characters have a Personality Card that gives them an added ability in the game like the ability to travel to a different part of the board without rolling dice, or getting the chance to see the same card someone just revealed to someone else.

Contraption cards will do things such as adding an extra six to your dice, taking an extra turn, or asking a bonus question.

This appears to be a simple roll-and-move game, with the theme of world railway travel, and based on an oval board game.

From the description on the back of the box:

First class, non-stop family fun from London to Rio via Delhi and Sydney!

Travel in style, stopping off at exotic locations to take in the sights. Watch out for obstacles that will slow down your journey, like leaves on the line, and hope to be sped up by express routes.

Set Up
Each passenger boards their train by placing a train token at the start of the train track.

How to Play
Passengers take turns in a clockwise order; youngest passenger starts. On your turn, roll the dice and move forward that many spaces. If you land on a space with text on it, read out the text and follow the instruction. If you throw a '6' you do not get another turn.

Winning
The first passenger to reach the end of the line and complete their journey wins. Keep playing until all trains have pulled in.

Contents: 
1 x game board
1 x die
8 x train tokens [blue, brown, green, pink, purple, orange, red, yellow]
